featured.text: The term “hula,” however, did not enter the English language until the 1700s, when British sailors first witnessed hula dancing in the Hawaiian Islands.

Bullard, having witnessed the life-saving power of the metal helmet in the War, decided to produce a head protection device that was affordable for every worker and lightweight enough to be worn all day long.

definition.en_def: A person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
definition.example: The witness testified in court about what they saw during the incident.
